You people really need to learn how to properly re-install windows, it is not like you are building a new computer.
1. Burn the Image File with any tool (PowerISO, Nero, etc.)
2. Burn the Image File at slowest possible speed with your DVD Drive (To ensure best results and bootable).
3. Restart Computer via BIOS Setup.
4. Change Boot Sequence to DVD Drive first, Harddrive second.
5. Exit BIOS (if done correctly Step 6 should work.)
6. Follow On-Screen Prompt (Boot from Disk Message should appear)
NOTE: You can use a legal CD-KEY of any computer that originally had Home Premium on it. YOU CANNOT USE Other Keys (Ultimate, Proffessional, etc)
SIDE-NOTE: If you are upgrading from previous versions of Windows, or upgrading from 32-Bit, make sure you hardware supports it, as you will be forced to do a CLEAN FORMAT. No questions asked.

Alright, I understand everything but, I just bought a bunch of parts to build a new computer and I was wondering, would the process still be the same for me?

I've installed this no problem, am currently d/ling updates. The dreaded 1033 update was already unchecked and thus far I haven't been prompted for any serial code at any stage. When will this happen?!?!

You're all morons. Just google "Virtual Clone Drive", set it up, and then download this. Now whenever you want to install a new OS or whatever that normally requires a long burning process or whatever else, all you have to do is right-click the ISO file and click "Mount" and select Virtual Clone Drive. Works just fine. No CDs, no burning, no difficult processes.
